name: Unauthenticated Access to AWS S3 Bucket After a Specific Date
description:
The ACME Company is preparing to release its financial statements for the quarterly results during an upcoming earnings call.
These statements will be accessible through a public S3 bucket. However, it is essential to ensure that the files are uploaded
to the bucket ahead of time, while public access should only be granted after the earnings call on a specified date and time.

To achieve this, please configure the S3 bucket policy to **restrict access before that designated date**.
Additionally, it is important to **ensure that older statements remain accessible without any date constraints**.
Below are the specific details for your reference.

 - **Restricted path**: `acme-earnings-calls/2025/04/*`
 - **Lift restrictions after**: `2025-04-07 13:00:00 UTC`
hints: You can manage access based on [date and time](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/reference_policies_examples_aws-dates.html)
You may want to explore condition keys for Amazon S3, particularly the [s3:prefix](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/service-authorization/latest/reference/list_amazons3.html#amazons3-s3_prefix) key.
